posts.name: Brody Anderson
posts.cooked: I started making an FRC Blockly app, but development has slowed do a lot due to school starting back up. This got me wondering though, what are your projects you’ve had to put on hold, or not gotten the chance to start yet? Do you plan to start them or pick them back up? Anything big holding you back?

posts.name: Mike Taylor (he/him)
posts.cooked:
I want to create a system that tracks FIRST alumni after graduation so that wherever they end up, they can connect with local teams (and vice versa).

The only thing holding me back is I don’t know how to do that.

posts.name: Brody Anderson
posts.cooked: Thanks for the suggestion! If my workload goes down I’ll try to contribute what I can

posts.name: Ari
posts.cooked: I spent a good portion of the summer working on an app that will ping scouts when their shift is about to start . I would say it’s going well but I accidentally deleted all the data it runs off of a week ago and it has been a struggle trying to fix it. Also kinda sabotaged it with my complete lack of name ideas.

posts.name: Owen Flanagan
posts.cooked: I’ve always wanted to create an automatic defense system where you give the robot a team number and it goes and bullies whatever team its been told too.

posts.name: SLAB-Mr.Thomas

lack of name ideas

That didn’t stop the TWAIN standard [Technology Without An Interesting Name].

posts.name: Brody Anderson
posts.cooked: That sounds pretty interesting! I can run it by my scouting team if you want, we have a few more off season comps this year if you need more beta testing

posts.name: Ari
posts.cooked: I would love to have more beta testers! The bot currently can’t even be installed right now unfortunately (because apparently that is done directly through the bots server and not slack). But hopefully it should be back up this weekend.

posts.name: Ainesh Yarlagadda
posts.cooked: Me and bro at frc made a dodgeball launcher using a old shooter we modified donated to us from another team and the 2021 power cells as the ammo. Absolutely fire

posts.name: Nobre
posts.cooked:
I’ve been developing a tool called PathPlanner SPIKE , which adapts the motion planning concepts of the FRC PathPlanner to the SPIKE Prime platform used in FLL .

TOPIC ABOUT THIS

The motivation behind this project is to offer FLL teams access to advanced trajectory generation tools, reducing their dependence on trial-and-error code and making it easier to build smooth, consistent autonomous routines. Just like PathPlanner has empowered FRC teams to fine-tune their paths and optimize autonomous modes, this tool brings similar functionality to the FLL context. It allows teams to visually design paths, automatically generate Python code with a custom control library tailored to SPIKE Prime, and execute the trajectory accurately on the competition field.

posts.name: Steven Lane
posts.cooked:
An NFL Redzone equivalent for matches.

Basically, you put in the teams you want to watch, and every time one of your teams is about to enter a match, the stream pops up. If multiple events are on at the same time that has teams of interest, it automatically goes to split screen. If there are no ‘favorite’ teams in a match, it picks out the most interesting match to show you and plays it. Watch all day Friday and Saturday, never have to switch streams or decide where to focus.

posts.name: Brian Wagg
posts.cooked:
Steven_Lane:

If there are no ‘favorite’ teams in a match, it picks out the most interesting match to show you and plays it.

For determining what the “most interesting" match is, it would be cool to crowd source that data. A website where folks can nominate or “favourite” matches at an event. Possibly even notifications for when that match is on deck.

***

Actually as I type this, it occurs to me that this would be a phenomenal Blue Alliance feature. And include a page highlighting the communities top matches they’re looking forward to that week, and make that info accessible through the API.

You can currently favourite specific teams and events on TBA , but I don’t believe you can favourite specific matches…

posts.name: Kai
posts.cooked: Before I graduated, I was working with a few others on a more publicly accessible knowledge base for rookies, but between our lack of general knowledge and the fact that like 2/3rds of the people on the project were graduating seniors, it kind of fizzled out. Maybe some year!

posts.name: Brody Anderson
posts.cooked: That sounds like a great project! I’ve been trying to start something similar for programming on my team

posts.name: Blake
posts.cooked: THIS 1000%. I have wanted this to be a reality for a decade now.

posts.name: Brody Anderson
posts.cooked: That sounds like a pretty interesting idea, I may look into twitch APIs and what not to see how difficult this would be to make

posts.name: MARS_James
posts.cooked:
For years I have been able to use my scouting sheet to predict individual matches based on our scouting data.

I finally took the time to make it actively predict the entire tournament, override said predictions when the match actually happens, and predict the overall rankings by the end of the tournament. Basically my own statbotics using scouted information not an algorithm.

This will allows to be more confident in guessing final rankings at the end of day 1 and as we head closer to alliance selection. The new sheet will also simulate alliance selection based on what I tell it to factor in order of importance each round.

This will cut hours of work from our scouting team over a tournament.

posts.name: runneals
posts.cooked: Develop an application agnostic scouting data exchange format so that teams can share data with each other.
